Banner.invitationText: We invite you to apply for the winter semester 2024/2025.

CtaHomePage.description: Enrollment for the 2024/2025 semester is now open. Join us and start your postgraduate studies adventure. We have prepared an exceptional offer of courses that will allow you to gain desired skills in the job market and open new perspectives for you.
CtaHomePage.imageAlt: Female student at a computer, recruitment 2024/2025

FinanceInformationSection.fundingTitle: Get funding from the Development Services Database
FinanceInformationSection.fundingDescription:
We hereby inform you that there is an opportunity to benefit from funding for postgraduate studies, courses, and training from the Development Services Database. The funding can cover 80-100% of the cost of educational services. 

We invite all interested parties to contact us for information on where to submit an application.
FinanceInformationSection.burOfferAriaLabel: explore our offer in the Development Services Database
FinanceInformationSection.loansDescription:
The Ministry of Development has launched interest-free loans for education, including postgraduate studies, courses, and training. Under the Operational Program Knowledge Education Development, you can receive up to 50,000 PLN in repayable assistance without any additional costs. 

Importantly, there is a possibility of cancelling 20-25% of the granted amount.

We encourage you to familiarize yourself with the information regarding interest-free loans. You can find more information on the website www.inwestujwrozwoj.pl

FaqSection.title: Find answers to your questions
FaqSection.description: Welcome to the FAQ section dedicated to postgraduate studies! Here you will find answers to the most frequently asked questions about recruitment, study programs, fees, course organization, and other issues related to postgraduate education at our university.
FaqSection.documentDeadline: Can I submit documents after the deadline?
FaqSection.documentDeadlineAnswer: No, WSH-E gives us a specific time by which we must have your documents prepared. Student ID numbers are also assigned by this time, which are necessary to qualify you for studies. After the deadline, WSH-E does not generate additional ID numbers, which means that applications are not accepted.
FaqSection.groupRec: Can we report a group of people for some one direction?
FaqSection.groupRecAnswer: Of course, yes. In this case, we make sure that everyone is in one group, if the group is large we allow the possibility of setting an individual schedule of meetings (the number of meetings is the same as in the study program, but classes can be held on other days, such as Fridays).
FaqSection.courseOrder: Can we order customized training from you?
FaqSection.courseOrderAnswer: Of course. There is such a possibility both in the area of on-site and remote training in real time. We also accept orders for online training to be listened to at a time and place of your choice.
FaqSection.parcticsMagnolia: Is there an internship opportunity at your Psychological and Pedagogical Clinic?
FaqSection.parcticsMagnoliaAnswer: Of course. We invite all willing students who would like to do specialized internships at PP-P MAGNOLIA in Rybnik. We provide therapies in speech therapy, neurology, sensory integration, hand therapy, tyflopedagogy, therapies with children on the autism spectrum, etc.  We also provide TUS classes, physiotherapy, psychological and pedagogical consultations, and conduct diagnoses. We cordially invite all interested persons to do their internship at PP-P MAGNOLIA.
FaqSection.parcticsOnlineAnswer: We are sorry but it is not possible. Internships should be held stationary in the number of hours provided in the curriculum. There are reasons to reduce the hours of internships, each request is considered individually by the Dean of WSH-E. The application should be submitted after the start of studies, up to 30 days after the start of classes.
FaqSection.diplomaCopy: How can I certify a copy of my diploma as true to the original?
FaqSection.diplomaCopyAnswer: You can certify it by writing the sentence: "I confirm this is a true copy of the original" on the copy and confirming it with your handwritten signature. This form is accepted by WSH-E.
FaqSection.doctoralDiploma: Can I send a copy of my doctoral studies diploma?
FaqSection.doctoralDiplomaAnswer: Unfortunately not, WSH-E only accepts copies of second degree diplomas.
FaqSection.shortenTwoSemesters: Can I complete a two-semester course in one semester?
FaqSection.shortenTwoSemestersAnswer: Absolutely not, a two-semester course cannot be shortened.
FaqSection.observationSheet: Who should sign the observation sheet?
FaqSection.observationSheetAnswer: The intern conducts classes that are observed by the Internship Supervisor who evaluates the intern. Therefore, the internship supervisor signs the document.
FaqSection.observationSheetModule: To which module should I attach the observation sheet?
FaqSection.observationSheetModuleAnswer: The observation sheet is attached to the module in which the intern is required to conduct classes independently.
FaqSection.internshipDeadline: When do I need to submit my internship documents?
FaqSection.internshipDeadlineAnswer: We submit internship documents as follows for the intake: October intake: March 30th of the following year, March intake: January 30th of the following year.
FaqSection.internshipSettlement: What does the internship submission/settlement deadline mean?
FaqSection.internshipSettlementAnswer: This means that if the settlement deadline is, for example, March 30th, the documents must be in the dean's office by March 30th at the latest in order to settle the internship on time.
FaqSection.completeDocuments: Why do I need to send all internship documents together?
FaqSection.completeDocumentsAnswer: Due to the number of students, it is very important that internship documents are sent together in accordance with the "specialist internship credit" file. Your documents are sent to WSH-E and checked there for content - the more missing documents, the longer you will wait for your certificate.
FaqSection.documentStatus: I haven't received a response about whether everything is okay with my internship documents, what does this mean?
FaqSection.documentStatusAnswer: Most often, this means that WSH-E has checked the documents and has no comments. Comments are sent to students via email. However, it's always worth contacting us in this case to double-check.

BannerFinanceCoursePage.title: Get funding from the Development Services Database
BannerFinanceCoursePage.description1: We encourage you to take advantage of the opportunity to obtain funding for training, courses, consulting services, and postgraduate studies from the Development Services Database.
BannerFinanceCoursePage.description2: The funding amount can range from 90% to 100% of the value of the development service (training/course/postgraduate studies).
BannerFinanceCoursePage.description3: Both individuals and entire enterprises can apply for funding.
BannerFinanceCoursePage.description4: We invite you to explore our offer. If you haven’t found the training that interests you, please contact us. It is possible to issue a training card dedicated to one person or a group of people, so-called on-demand training.
BannerFinanceCoursePage.description5: We also encourage you to contact Employment Offices, where you will be informed about current funding opportunities and areas of support.
BannerFinanceCoursePage.buttonAriaLabel: explore our offer in the Development Services Database

RecruitmentPage.recruitmentDescription: The recruitment for postgraduate studies is completed in a few steps. Below you will find step-by-step instructions that will guide you through the recruitment process. If you encounter any difficulties, we encourage you to contact us through the form, and our team will assist you.

form.name: Name
form.submitSuccess: Thank you for submitting your message

steps.title: See how to enroll in postgraduate studies step by step
steps.description: To join the student community, you need to complete a few steps. We have prepared detailed instructions that will allow you to go through the entire process without problems.

step1.title: Fill out the application form
step1.description: On our website, you will find an application form that needs to be filled out. Make sure the information provided is correct and complete.

step2.title: Prepare required documents
step2.description: You need to attach a copy of your higher education diploma, confirmation of the enrollment fee payment, and a copy of the agreement you will receive after filling out the form. Make sure all documents are up to date.

step3.title: Submit documents
step3.description: All documents can be sent electronically to the email address: nowekwalifikacjerybnik@gmail.com or submitted in person at our office at ul. Magnolii 25, 44-207 Rybnik.

step4.title: Confirmation of acceptance
step4.description: After positive consideration of your application, you will receive an official confirmation of admission to postgraduate studies.

step5.title: Having a problem?
step5.description: If you have any questions or concerns about the recruitment process, please contact us by phone at +48 797 173 501 or by email: nowekwalifikacjerybnik@gmail.com

wykladowcy.opis: Master in pedagogy specializing in counseling and psychopedagogical assistance. Active special educator, hand therapist, specialist in inclusive education, and lecturer. She has extensive experience, sharing her knowledge with both students and teachers in various educational institutions. Specialist at ORE in the field of inclusive education.

Psychotherapist, sexologist, and mentor with 20 years of experience in individual and group work with men and women on relationships. Conducts sessions and workshops in Poland, Sweden, and Germany. Specializes in individual therapy, couples therapy, family therapy, and child therapy. As a systemic psychotherapist, he uses an integrative approach, drawing from various streams that best serve the patient, guiding them toward conscious self-understanding. His favorite therapeutic approach is Frankl's logotherapy. He specializes in couples therapy, crisis intervention, addictions, relationship difficulties, identity issues, anxiety, depression, and sexual problems.
Master in special pedagogy, certified teacher, education and rehabilitation therapist for individuals with autism spectrum disorder, TUS trainer, and educator at a Special School Complex.

Master in psychology specializing in clinical sexology and criminological psychology. Lecturer in postgraduate studies in special pedagogy, sexology, and clinical sexology. Therapist for children, couples, and families. Actively engaged in working with children in schools and kindergartens. Specialist at ORE in the field of inclusive education.

Master in English and history, ICT trainer and moderator, MIEE Educator, trainer for foreign national Erasmus agencies, and speaker at international and national conferences. Specialist at ORE in the field of inclusive education. ICT trainer focusing on the use of new technologies in working with students with special educational needs. Lecturer in postgraduate studies in education management, history, and English language.

Certified sociologist (specializing in human resource management), certified specialist in environmental protection, and career advisor promoting ecological awareness. PhD in pedagogy at the Maria Grzegorzewska Academy of Special Education in Warsaw. Academic lecturer in natural science-oriented universities. Author of numerous scientific and post-conference publications. Focused on ecological education in enterprises, public institutions, NGOs, and educational institutions (preschools and primary schools) for several years.

Master in psychology with a focus on neuropsychology and clinical psychology. Specialist in integrated early childhood education, IT education, and education and rehabilitation of people with intellectual disabilities. WWRD and hippotherapy therapist. Specialist in alternative and augmentative communication and diagnosis of alternative and augmentative communication methods.

Master in Polish philology, specialist in pedagogical therapy, diagnosis, and social prevention. Therapist in the diagnosis of developmental dyslexia, TELC language examiner, teacher of Polish as a foreign language, and president of the Dyslexia Society branch in Rybnik. Advisor and author of publications for the Institute of Educational Research. Works with gifted students (preparing for exams/competitions).

Master in psychology, psychotherapist. Therapist for adults, couples, and families. Specialist in psychotherapy at the Crisis Intervention Center, Mental Health Clinic, Neurosis Treatment Clinic, and Day Neurosis Treatment Department. Focused on working with whole families and adults.

Master in pedagogy – specialization in care and education, oligophrenopedagogue, specialist at ORE in the field of inclusive education, active special educator. Lecturer in special pedagogy at postgraduate studies.

Master in Polish philology, speech therapist, TELC Polish language examiner, trainer of Polish as a foreign language, active teacher in primary and secondary schools, speech therapy session therapist. Trainer in the field of inclusive education. Lecturer in postgraduate studies.

Master in psychology, psycho-oncologist, certified psychotherapist of the Polish Society for Experiential Integrative Psychotherapy and Social Education, music therapist. Psychodietitian, trainer of modern career and educational counseling. Therapist specializing in couples therapy, EFT – emotion-focused therapy, and work with children and youth. Specialist in inclusive education. Lecturer in postgraduate studies in her areas of specialization.

Trainer in digital competencies, specialist in copyright law, artificial intelligence, virtual and augmented reality. Master in economics and finance, business trainer, coach, and vocational training instructor. Active in the industry since 2015, specializing in digital competencies and computer graphics. Graduate of finance and economics at the University of Economics in Katowice, she is keenly interested in digitalization and copyright issues in education. Passionate about innovative technologies and artificial intelligence, while maintaining a strong interest in computer graphics.
Speech therapist and neurologist with numerous qualifications in her field, such as working with children with mutism, stuttering, auditory perception disorders, and hearing impairments.

Doctor of Philosophy. Lecturer in ethics and philosophy. Active teacher of ethics and philosophy in primary and secondary schools. Trainer working with gifted students – preparation for German language certifications. Specialist in knowledge about young people. Author of ethics class scenarios for all educational levels. Specialist at ORE in the field of inclusive education.

Master in pedagogy specializing in preschool and early childhood education, oligophrenopedagogy, elementary education with additional English language, active special educator in primary school, specialist at ORE in the field of inclusive education, TUS trainer for children with autism spectrum disorders, and education and therapy for individuals with autism spectrum disorder. Lecturer in postgraduate studies in special pedagogy.

Graduate of Medical University in Wrocław: neurologopedics with early speech therapy intervention, University of Wrocław: general logopedics, and Polish philology. Certified Functional Orthodontics MFS Therapist, Sensory Integration Therapy (I level), and many other qualifications. Conducts speech therapy for children and youth with various disorders, including ASD, aphasia, developmental delays, and severe disabilities.

StudyFormats.title: Choose a study format that fits your needs
StudyFormats.description: We offer two forms of postgraduate studies that allow you to adapt learning to your lifestyle and preferences. Choose the option that best suits your needs.
StudyFormats.inPersonDescription: Traditional form of studies where all classes take place at the university. Direct contact with lecturers and other students fosters relationships and exchange of experiences.
StudyFormats.hybridDescription: Modern form of studies combining remote classes in real-time with selected in-person classes. An ideal solution for people who value flexibility and convenience.
StudyFormats.inPersonSchedule: Classes take place on weekends (Saturdays and Sundays) according to the established schedule.
StudyFormats.hybridSchedule: Some classes are held remotely in real-time, and selected practical classes are conducted in-person on weekends.
StudyFormats.inPersonInteraction: Direct contact with lecturers during classes, possibility of personal consultations.
StudyFormats.hybridInteraction: Online contact during remote classes and direct contact during in-person classes.
StudyFormats.inPersonBestFor1: Prefer direct contact with lecturers and other students
StudyFormats.inPersonBestFor2: Value learning in a traditional academic environment
StudyFormats.hybridBestFor1: Have limited ability to commute to the university
StudyFormats.hybridBestFor3: Can effectively learn in an online environment
StudyFormats.additionalInfo: Regardless of the chosen form of studies, the curriculum, requirements, and qualifications obtained are the same. Choose the form that best suits your lifestyle and preferences.
